title: NASA’s Megarocket Will Head Back to Garage After Second Failed Launch Attempt
description: A serious and unmanageable hydrogen leak prevented NASA from launching its SLS rocket on Saturday. Teams continue to evaluate the reason for the second failed launch attempt, but NASA says the rocket will have to return to the Vehicle Assembly Building to undergo safety checks.

title: John Williams Debuts the First Music for Indiana Jones 5, and It's Great

title: 2007's Trick 'r Treat is Finally Coming to Theaters

title: Labor Day Heat Wave Out West
Scrubbed Again: NASA Calls Off Second SLS Launch Attempt Due to Hydrogen Leak
description: Update: 11:23 a.m. ET: Today’s launch has been scrubbed on account of the hydrogen leak. Launch director Charlie Blackwell-Thompson formally agreed to the scrub at 11:19 a.m ET. title: What's Causing These Geological Formations on the Great Salt Lake?
